reviewText:
SO The Rock is finally getting a documentary set. Perfect time as he is wrestling what will likely be his final match at WM28 just weeks after this is officially out.

Disc 1 - Documentary (chapters already listed by another user).

I really wanna go through just some of the following:

SSeries 96 - Debut of The Rock (or as he was called at the time, Rocky Miavia). Rock's come a hell of a long way from what you'll see here. Especially with the hair lol! Debuting at SSeries in MSG? How many people, if any can top that? Rock' team consisted of Marc Mero (he was still The Wildman), Barry Windham & Jake Roberts. Their opponents? HHH, Goldust, Crush, and Lawler.

SSlam 98 - The infamous Ladder match from one of the best ppvs & one of the best SSlam's in WWE. It's been released & seen before. But it's one of Rock's best matches & deserves to be on here.

Breakdown: IYH - Rock, Shamrock, Mankind in a triple threat Steel Cage match. If that isn't enough, the winner is supposedly the #1 Contender. And I say supposedly because I'm not sure if the winner actually got his one on one Title match before the SSeries 98 Deadly Game Tournament.

Royal Rumble 99 - The I Quit match! Rock vs Mankind. This is a brutal, brutal match. And that is putting it mildly. Make sure your kids/younger siblings are dreaming while you watch this.

Backlash 99 - I'm glad this is here because as great as Austin vs Rock was at WM15, I liked this one a bit better & they've had better WM bouts.

SSlam 2000 - Rock vs Angle vs HHH for the WWE Title. It was a great bout. Great build-up too.

Raw, 12/18/00 - Here, we have Rock & Taker (in his biker days. The ABA to be more specific) against E&C (Edge & Christian) for the Tag Titles. A rare bout. And a good one.

Raw, 07/29/02 - Rock defends the Undisputed Title against Flair. They could've added something else instead of this. Not saying it was bad. There were just better stuff from Rock's career.

SSlam 2002 - This time, The Rock doesn't defend the Undisputed Title against a legend. He defends it against a young, hungry up & coming powerhouse.

No Way Out 2003 - The rematch from WM18. It would have fit if they added that match too. But this a more rare match compared to that one. The WM18 match had a better feel to it though. The atmosphere, buildup, event it was held, it all just fit the first time.

Raw, 2/14/11 - The WM27 guest host is revealed. The Rock returned to the WWE! FINALLY!

The People's WrestleMania
WrestleMania XXVII 3rd April, 2011

BLU-RAY EXTRAS

Raw, 4/4/11 - Unprecedented. All I gotta say to this.

The Rock's Birthday Celebration
Raw 2nd May, 2011

SSeries 2011 - At MSG, it is Never Before, Never Again as Rock teams with his WM28 opponent, John Cena to face Awesome Truth.

Farmland

People's Elbow

Toy Chest

The Rock Thanks New York City

Below is the synopsis and content listing for "The Rock: The Epic Journey of Dwayne Johnson." The DVD and Blu-ray set will be released on February 21st.

"He electrified a generation of sports entertainment fans with his brash style, superb athleticism, and uproarious interviews. He held the WWE Championship a record seven times, and was known for legendary battles with ''Stone Cold'' Steve Austin, Triple H, Mick Foley, Undertaker, and more. And at the peak of his popularity, he made a move to conquer a new industry, becoming an enormous movie star. Now, he's back in WWE, ready to main event the biggest WrestleMania in history, ''The People's WrestleMania.'' In the exciting buildup to WrestleMania XVIII, fans can, for the first time ever on DVD, relive the exciting life and times of the Rock. Packed with brand new interviews as well as a selection of the Rock's biggest career-spanning bouts, moments, and promos, this DVD/Blu-Ray set will electrify every member of Team Bring It!"

Overall, This is the Rock and worth the buy. I like the match listing aside from a few repeats. However, I didn't buy Survivor Series 2011 because I figured it would be on this set. Disappointing its on blu ray only, WWE seems to want people to convert to blu ray with really important matches being found only on blu ray of late.

So I own the rock Just Bring It which was a decent dvd had rock talk but mainly just about his late 00-summer 2001 carrer such as movies his fued with austin comming back when wwf was facing wcw etc. The 2nd dvd the rock most elecfrying man was just matches but was good. Im hoping this dvd goes into deatail about his whole carrer&has some matches that are rare to dvd or matches that have only been released on ppv dvds not his most elcerfrying man or just bring it dvd

This should be an interesting set in that The Rock will actually contribute to it, unlike The Most Electrifying Man in Sports Entertainment set. But couldn't they have waited until after WrestleMania  28 so that his match with John Cena could be included? Hard to know ahead of time, but it likely would be worth having on the set.
Very good movie. I love Dwayne Johnson.  Transaction was great.  No problems at all.
Best Rock dvd
I got this for my boyfriend because he is a huge fan of the Rock. No complaints, talks about the rock and shows some of his best matches. What more could you ask for?
THANKS!!...WWE.ROCK.BLU-RAY.FOREVER.
great

The documentary is well made and covers The Rock's early beginnings with his families' roots in wrestling(Peter Mavia & Rocky Johnson) and goes onto his start in the wrestling business with all the early struggles getting accepted by the fans. Then the transition from Rocky Mavia to The Rock joining The Nation and turning heel is where his character began to shine. And it is nice hearing from the Rock in the documentary as he was not directly involved in the previous release of his DVD.

I have no problem with the match selection on this set. The only thing I would have liked more was if this could have been a 3-disc Blu-ray set similar to the Stone Cold Blu-ray set rather than just a 2-disc set. The Rock had a legendary run and more material could have been included(especially with all of his entertaining promos). But as it is, still a very good set and does a nice job of covering The Rock's amazing career.
My Grandson LOVED IT
Great
We bought this as a gift for someone who is a huge fan of The Rock. She loved it! It gave her a nice overview and background history to The Rock.
Excelent!!!!

This is great to have for any Rock or wrestling fan to have. However, I wish they could have put at least a few more matches on discs two and three. One match that should be on here is the match between Triple H and The Rock at Backlash in 2000. For me that was a huge win for The Rock. Another match that should've been included was the Icon vs. Icon match. That was the match between Hulk Hogan and The Rock at WrestleMania X8. It is talked about on disc one; which is the story of The Rock's life and he became a professional wrestler. But still it would've been nice if we got the actual match. The next match that should've been included was the triple threat match at No Mercy in 2002. It was between The Rock, The Undertaker, and Kurt Angle. It was really a great match between all three combatants, and it's shame its not on this DVD release. And now for the big one. The match that should've absolutely been on this DVD release was the final match between "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and The Rock at WrestleMania X9. The reason I say that is because for me that match really marked the end of the Attitude Era. And those two were really the two big faces of the WWE during that era. This would be Steve Austin's final match due to his neck injury he got way back in SummerSlam 1997, it finally caught up to him. And The Rock would have a few more matches after this, but would go on to perform in movies. Even though, it's not the DVD release. Any Rock fan should get this because its an incredible story and you still get some pretty good matches. Even though, it would've been nice to have those matches I listed above on the DVD as well.

I really enjoyed the whole history of the Rock.  I was not too impressed with the Fighting or should I say acting. It was quite overdone and very obvious that it was Phony. They take turns letting their opponent beat the crap out of them, without protecting themselves and then when you think someone is 3/4 dead he springs to life and takes his turn beating the hell out of his opponent. Always seams to be a one way battle until they play switch.
watchin it now the documentry's great, but so far my lone gripe is . . . where the heck's the CC options???? othere then that it's a great set
My husband really likes the Rock so I got this for him, and it was a big hit.  There is a documentary and some fight footage.
It was a gift for my cousin. They loved it!

I love this movies!
Get this dvd if Youre A fan of The Rock just unexplainable ive been a fan of his since i started watching wwe at the age of 4 or 5 he was the very 1st wrestler that i saw on the television

My boyfriend loves this for his 24th birthday! And shipped really fast got it to him on time:) he was more than happy and little does he know it was so cheap! Thanks a bunch I would defiantly buy from you again
Great Movie and Seller!!
Awesome
My work mom is obsessed with the Rock and she said this DVD was super amazing and she watched all 7.5 hours of it in one day!
This DVD was a great look into the career of The Rock. My husband was so surprised when I gave it to him for Christmas.
Love this 3 DVD set
Good
I like that it talks about the rock
EXCELLENT!!!

Dwayne Johnson in the role of a lifetime. Before Scorpion King, Before Hercules, Before THE TOOTH FAIRY..there was THE ROCK. The Rock is all things. Superhero, Supervillan, Comic,  The Peoples Champion laying the Smackathdown on a bunch of candy a##es long before he EVER ran Fast And Furious.

How did the Rock get his start? This is where you find out. How did the Rock go from Wrestler to movie star? Watch this video. If Steve Austin was the a##kicker of the attitude era then The Rock was its entertainer. When he left for Hollywood, Rock left a void on the Mic in Wrestling that only one man came close to filling. CM Punk. Pure, unrefined ego driven attitude. For every Kid friendly wrestler (Hoagan/Cena) there has to be a one man wrecking crew on the Microphone. Rock knew how to drive that intensity on the Mic which made his matches a must see. It was only natural to take that charisma to Hollywood as an Action hero.

A must see for all Rock and Dwayne Johnson fans.

There is no one in sports entertainment today that can match the Charisma and Electricity that THE ROCK produces when he's in the middle of a WWE ring. From a long line of Samoan wrestlers and a father of great means (Rocky Johnson one of the best of his time), Dwayne Johnson came from greatness but he didn't start wanting to be a wrestler until later on. When he decided to enter the ring... he was destined to be THE GREAT ONE. Through his highs and lows, The Rock NEVER gave up telling all to JUST BRING IT... and The Rock did Bring It... every night. I was an avid fan in the Attitude Era when The Rock began and starred in the WWE. I have to say he always brought every thing to that ring. There was never a dull moment with The Rock. One of the BEST OF THE BEST ... truly inspiring individual in and out of the ring. The Rock IS the People's Champion... then, now, FOREVER.
great dvd
A good complement to the first anthology released of the Rock.
Purchased for my husband.  He loved it!

This documentary chronicles the wrestling career very well, however I wanted to hear more stories told on growing up, his football career, & his personal life, overall it is a good documentary, but not great!
The documentary portion of this set is awesome. It really goes into great detail about the Rock's history. I wish all of the WWE dvd's would be this thorough.
a amazing dvd set if you like the rock and want to see his journey from the good guy to the rock :)

its ok..could've put some better matches..the matches that were in this..were simply too long.and i've seen alot of good 10-15 min ROCK matches.good bio and maybe 4 good matches including hulk vs rock and rock vs flair...if your a really big rock fan...its a must if you simply just collect wwe dvds a maybe...depending if you find it for under 5 bucks like i did
This DVD goes inside the true story behind the superstar that we know as The Rock. I would recommend this to any wrestling fans.
Because the rock is the most electrifying man in sports entertainment. If ya SMEEELLLLLLLLLLLL what the rock is cooking!!!!!! No matter what Stone cold is still my #1 guy.

Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is probably one of the more fascinating lives of our era.  His background, his determination and his continued striving for greatness is something I want my children to see and immulate.  This dvd gives a clearer understanding of why he is who he is today and gives hope that the market for greatness has not been cornered--there's room for anyone who will work hard to obtain his/her dreams.
I love this dvd set. He is one of my favorite characters in the WWF universe. I recommend this to all sports people.
What can you say about the Rock.  He just gets better with age. Such an interesting man--I love watching anything he's in.
Gift for boyfriend-He LOVED it as he LOVES the Rock....Not creepy at all...I recommend it for your boyfriend as well.

This is such a great DVD collection! It really makes you realize what an amazing man Dwayne Johnson is...AMAZING!! I prefer the #1 disc as it's all about his life & work but the matches are fun to watch too...for the most part. Some are just a bit too violent for me.
This documentary the rock is epic. I loved it. For any rock fan or just someone trying to learn more about the peoples champion. If you smell what the rock is cookin
Shows Dwayne Johnson's epic journey from the birth of this legend. I found this really inspirational as I'm a die hard Dwayne Johnson fan. I recommend this to all who idolize this legend!

I purchased this video for my husband and he loved it.  I am very happy with this
purchase and so is my husband. I got a great deal.

The Rock truly is the most electrifying man in sports entertainment.  I doubt if will ever be a man that can entertain fans the way the Rock does, albeit his wrestling ability or his gift of gab.  The man is an absolute physical specimen with a stage presence that is second to none.  Sorry Muhammad Ali you also had those gifts.  Through this collection I get to smell what the Rock is cooking whenever I want.  So get your rudy pooh candy asses in gear and buy this incredible compilations of the Rock's greatest smackdowns and rockbottoms.  If you fail to get this collection of the Rock's greatest hits you need to check yourself into the smackdown hotel for some R & R (rest and recuperation).  As the Big Cat Ernie Ladd would say you have already missed the two greatest events in your life the birth of your mother and father.  Don't miss out on this DVD, highly entertaining.
The seller provides great service, speedy delivery is the norm.
This is a great story telling of The Rock. Finally a story detailing his life from college football to the people's champ. A must have for any wrestling fan.
I'm not much into wresling. My hubby likes that kind of stuff.  I like Dwayne in some of the movies he is in

My boyfriend is obsessed with The Rock, and i can't say i hate looking at him ;) - this is an awesome movie/documentary on The Rock and with lots of great matches in between. Super good buy for any Rock fan!
Very well put together as most WWE documentaries are. Enjoyed the commentaries from superstars, family and friends. A must have for a fan.

Well I pretty much wanted this dvd because I saw it on sale at walmart and I remember growing up obsessed with the rock and all his fights but I didn't have cable growing up so I missed lots of the fights and to now have it all in one set it amazing!

Watching this DVD, definitely remarkable. It would've been better if it was released later to include the buildup and match at Wrestlemania 28. Otherwise very well put together. It includes 10 matches not 11 plus 3 promos. Definitely recommended.

Another wrestling dvd performance to add to the ones i have --Hulk hogan and andre the giant --  covers from his beginning career to the end... although the last 2  episodes are offbeat no wrestling just him being funny...last sentimental with him saying hes come home but  not much else to the lenghthy episode

I loved the rock as a kid. He made a whole new show called SmackDown. He also made 100 of catch phrases. He had all the tools to be the #1 performer in the WWE at his time and beyond. But, he was even bigger than that because he went on to make movies that we love. He showed the world how great he was. He did movies with and after the WWE. He has come back to the WWE so many times. And he always entertain the fans.

The documentary really showed us how he first started out in the WWE. It told us why he went to the WWE in the first place. I do remember seeing the Rock in his first match and hated the guy. He looked too fake and I guess so did so many other fans. As time passed, his character suddenly came out and he let the true nature and personality come out. We all thought Rocky sucks and all of a suddenly, well maybe not. Then, when the Rock became a good guy. We all heard the words....Finallly!  And, now the world loves him!

I documentary showed us that the Rock can be a good guy or bad guy and the fans still love him. It doesn't matter what he does! We know the Rock can do movies and the WWE because he can do anything! I recommend this documentary so that people will know how the Dwayne Johnson became the Rock!

A good collection of career highlights for "The Rock" Dwayne Johnson. So why only three stars?

A Blu Ray disc can hold (according to the Blu-Ray.com information site) "Over 9 hours of high-definition (HD) video". This two-disc WWE set comes nowhere near that capacity or content. You can count the number of matches included on both hands. Both discs are indistinguishable from the normal amount of material you'd get on DVD.

This collection is more of "Gee, what has Rock been doing since The Scorpion King", which is useful and interesting in its own way. The interviews with Triple HHH, Chris Jericho, John Cena, and a few (very few) others are well done. So what extras do you get for shelling out more cash for Blu Ray?

The Blu Ray extras consists of 4 very short clips that would normally be listed as DVD extras. This in no way justifies the added price of a Blu Ray release. I will consider very carefully future WWE releases that promise to deliver more with Blu Ray. This absolutely did not, Rock fans will feel cheated with this misuse of Blu Ray technology.
I wouldn't recommend really recommend this. Not very well put together at all. Not much of a documentary. They rushed this out for Wrestlemania 28 and it really showed.

I am a huge Dwayne Johnson fan so I had to have this dvd. I love how there are interviews along with some of his best matches, I highly recamend any Dwayne Johnson fan to get it, or if you're just a plan old wrestleing fan.

This has to be one of the most intense dvds reguarding a wrestler not to mention some great picks in matches everything about this dvd is electrifying my only let down is the lack of great matches he only had 8 or 9 matches hopefully in the future they can make a dvd with over 35 of his greatest matches and moments other than that i recommend this dvd to any WWE fan,Rock Fan and an Attitude Era Fan

If you were not sure whether to buy this or "The Rock: The Most Electrifying Man in Sports Entertainment" dvd/blu-ray set,  than don't worry I have the answer.  This dvd/blu-ray (The Rock: The Epic Journey of Dwayne Johnson) shows the history of the Rock in its entirely.  Because the Rock is not even interview  in "The Rock: The Most Electrifying Man in Sports Entertainment,"  this dvd/blu-ray is the one you want to buy if you are a Rock or wresting fan in general. In sum, buy this one and not "The Rock: The Most Electrifying Man in Sports Entertainment"

Wrestlemania 28 rock vs cena, and the winner will be john cena. The rock has been out of wrestling for more then 8 years and even then he lost more matches then he won. The only reason he is back is because people was forgetting who he was, so too remind people he would just pop back up in wrestling, too sell more of his movie tickets. John cena like him or not has been on the road busting his butt for the buisness he loves. You can say all the child like remarks you want to about him, but he is the reason people buy wwe tickets and watch the tv shows. That is why i says cena boot to rock ass, because i believe cena will win at wrestlemania 28.  ALSO, ROCKY SUCKS, LETS GO CENA !!!!!!!!

This is one of the best documentaries I've ever seen, a lot of insight very informative and if you are a wrestling fan this 3 set video is a lot of fun. To quote the most electrifying man in all of entertainment, 'If you smellllllllllllllllllllll what the ROCK IS COOKING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

To start off The Epic Journey of The Rock is Great. Though I agree with some they could have put in some other great matches like the one with The Rock vs Triple H in an ironman match at judgement day....I don't get why wwe does not want to put that match in any dvd sets including triple h's dvd's.

With that said I enjoyed watching the evolution of Dwayne Johnson as well as the matches but what I am NOT HAPPY about is that WWE chose to give special exclusives to the Blu Ray...I actually wanted to see Cena/Rock team up against the awesome truth as well as Rock's celebration, but WWE chose to screw the fans who own only DVD players...sucks big time.

Although he calls himself the "Most Electrifying Man In Sports Entertainment"...it's really hard to argue it as he's without a doubt the biggest crossover star in the history of the business as both The Rock in wrestling & Dwayne Johnson in Hollywood.  Despite making a few cameo appearances here & there over the years, he's back to tell his story here as this is the first documentary that covers his career from beginning to the present time.  You'll hear new comments from The Rock himself throughout the documentary along with others involved in his career including his parents Ata & Rocky Johnson, Vince McMahon, NFL player Warren Sapp, his ex-wife Dany Garcia, Pat Patterson, Jim Ross, Triple H, Mick Foley, Ron Simmons, Steve Austin, John Cena, C.M. Punk, Chris Jericho, Hulk Hogan, Cheri Oteri from 'Saturday Night Live', Carson Daly, Michael Clark Duncan, and Chuck Russell who was the director of "The Scorpion King."

The documentary starts off talking about Rock growing up in the business through Peter Maivia & Rocky Johnson with people sharing their memories of him at the events (including footage of him in the crowd at shows) before going into his football career from his days as an all-american to the University Of Miami (with comments from his fellow teammate Warren Sapp) to his year in the CLF.  Him breaking into the business was discussed next from the story of how he got his dad to train him to the phone call leading up to his debut where everyone saw that he had the talent.  The problems with Rocky Maivia was heavily discussed here with the "Rocky Sucks" chants & crowd starting to turn on him to the point where Foley points out that the biggest babyface reaction his Mankind character got at that point came in a match against Rocky while The Rock himself points out the frustrations with the character being something that everyone saw through. His time in the Nation Of Domination & how he was slowly starting to stand out above the rest of the group was talked about next to his feud with Triple H & what thought went into their ladder match back at SummerSlam 1998.  Everything that went into The Rock becoming the Corporate Champion was discussed next including his feud with Mankind with details of how both men traded the traditional roles each other would have had just based off their looks along & raised the bar in regards to taking punishment to the point where Foley himself said the "I Quit" match was maybe too brutal.  The documentary continued talking about the match against Steve Austin at WrestleMania XV with both men fighting for the #1 spot in the company to the point where an autograph Austin gave Rock heavily motivated him before going into the issues Rock was having staying a heel as the fans really started to connect with him through things like his catchphrases to the point where one of them is actually in the dictionary.  His tag team with Mankind as the Rock N' Rock Connection was up next with how it helped showcase another side of Mick Foley with "the buffoon & the stud" being able to play off each other so well & how they still have the most watched segment in RAW history.  His World Title feud with Triple H was discussed before going into his ability to become a crossover star in the media from his appearances to Saturday Night Live, the Republican National Convention, and his appearance in "The Mummy Returns."  His WrestleMania X-7 match against Austin, his "Scorpion King" movie, his ability to entertain the crowd by saying things others wish they could say with Chris Jericho recalling the night him & Rock were murdering Stephanie McMahon on the microphone, and the "Icon vs. Icon" vs. Hulk Hogan at WrestleMania X8 was discussed next with John Cena making a very important point about how important the crowd is to a match.  One of the biggest parts of the presentation came next in regards to the crowd starting to turn against Rock because they took it personal that he was spending more time making moves than wrestling which allowed himself to reinvent himself in the arrogant heel which others brought up the point of "was he really a heel?" due to his ability to still entertain the crowd before talking about his final encounter with Austin at Mania.  The focus then shifted to Rock's acting career with him stating why he left WWE for all those years while others gave their opinions on his various movie roles (including Doom...LOL) & talking about his various WWE returns like WrestleMania XX & inducting his family in the Hall Of Fame before ending the documentary talking about returning at the WrestleMania XXVII guest host, his issues with John Cena leading up to this year's WrestleMania, and his Happy Birthday celebration.

Blu-Ray extras include the challenge to John Cena for WrestleMania XXVIII, the opening & final segment of his birthday celebration on RAW, Rock talking about a promo he did, various highlights of memories of "The People's Elbow", Rock & Vince McMahon talking about the WWE being his "toy chest", and Rock talking to the NYC crowd after Survivor Series '11.

Matches Include:
Elimination Match w/Marc Mero, Barry Windham, Jake "The Snake" Roberts vs. Hunter Hearst-Helmsley, Goldust, Crush, Jerry Lawler - It should be noted that Sunny joined Jim Ross & Vince McMahon on commentary here that resulted in some bickering between her & Ross while Jake Roberts replaced an injured Mark Henry (the first of many injures in his career). The main story of this match was the debut of the man we now know as Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson but here, he was Rocky Maivia & built as WWE's first 3rd generation athlete taking the combining the names of his grandfather & dad...and it's also ironic that there are 3 other generational wrestlers in this match as well. This was one of those matches that told various stories such as Hunter avoiding Mero throughout the contest & the issues between Jake Roberts & Jerry Lawler but this was ultimately a showcase for Rocky but a solid encounter overall.
Survivor Series '96

Intercontinental Championship/Ladder Match vs. Triple H - Just a couple of notes before the match but the DX band played Triple H & Chyna to the ring, The Rock debuted a new version of his "Nation" theme while Mark Henry was in Rock's corner, and Triple H was coming into the match with a bad leg based off an attack earlier in the night.  Both men started out in the ring before the brawl continued into the isleway with Triple H being thrown into the ladder leaning against the ring.  Triple H swinging it into Rock followed by driving it into his ribs before Rock recovered & went right to work on that bad leg with stomps & elbow drops before using the ladder to wedge the leg & stomp on it along with using a chair to hammer the ladder into Triple H's leg.  Rock was ruthless by dropping Triple H onto the ladder leg first before Triple H was catapulted & backdropped onto it various times before Rock eventually dropped a People's Elbow with Triple H on the ladder.  The Rock & Triple H just have that natural chemistry that carries over into each match & this was no different in a classic quality match that told a great story.
SummerSlam '98
[The Ladder Match]

Steel Cage Match vs. Mankind vs. Ken Shamrock - The setup behind this match was very different as neither man had anything in common with the other except they had common enemies in the previous weeks in both Undertaker & Kane leading to these three put into this match to determine the new #1 contender for the WWE Championship.  Rock & Shamrock renewed their rivalry from the first half of the year by trading punches while Mankind tried to sneak out the door right away.  We saw some unique moves involving all three men like a double abdominal stretch & double People's Elbow while every man had an alliance with one superstar to work over the other at one point in the match.  It was a good triple threat match with one highlight being Mankind once again attempting his "Superfly Jimmy Snuka" moment.
Breakdown '98

"I Quit" Match vs. WWE Champion Mankind - Throughout all of the battles between Rock vs. Mankind, this is the most infamous one of them all.  Both men attempted to make the other quick early with each man's answer being such a smart-ass response that it was almost comedic at times.  The brawl went from the ring to the outside with various weapons used from the microphone itself to the steel steps to a steel chair with Rock even joining in on commentary at one point.  They continued to fight through the crowd to the stage area with Rock dishing out punishment from a powerslam over the barrier to using the ring bell before continuing to the stage area where Foley took such a beating that the electrical equipment was damaged & even Shane McMahon was trying to tell Rock to back off.  Right around here was the incident that this match is most remembered for as Mankind was handcuffed & continued to fight before The Rock used a chair including nine (YES, NINE) unprotected chair shots to Mankind's head that was still cringe worthy to watch back then a decade before the research of hits to the head & the long term effects of it was made public knowledge...to the point where Mankind's (Mick Foley) wife stopped watching & his children were crying at ringside before leaving backstage.  This was a very physical match but definitely very violent towards the end.
Royal Rumble '99

No Holds Barred Match vs. WWE Champion Steve Austin w/Special Guest Referee Shane McMahon - This was the rematch from WrestleMania XV with The Rock with Austin on a mission to get back his personalized "Smoking Skull" title which The Rock was wearing.  Both men traded fist right from the bell with Shane distracting Austin for Rock to gain an advantage followed by both men trading momentum before both men brawled to the stage area as both men were thrown into the set at one point with various weapons used like the cable cord, fire extinguisher, guardrail, and anvil case.  The fight went back to ringside with Rock being able to put Austin through the spanish table & even showed he was diverse at being able to not only do commentary but also be a camera man.  Shane continued to show his bias as a referee by constantly taking causing distractions, making threats, and even taking weapons away from Austin & giving them to The Rock but it would eventually backfire in Austin's favor before Austin would receive some help from the last man he would ever expect it from.  This match definitely topped their Mania match from the previous month & one of the best matches in their epic feud.
Backlash '99
[Legacy Of "Stone Cold" Steve Austin]

WWE Championship Match vs. Kurt Angle vs. Triple H - Although this is a match from the WWE Championship, that was more of an afterthought in the minds of the challengers as Triple H came to the ring looking for revenge against Kurt Angle to kissing his wife Stephanie to the point where Triple H brawled with Kurt & ended up delivering a pedigree on the spanish table that gave away causing Kurt to land on his head knocking him out & had him taken to the back before The Rock even made his entrance to start the match.  The Rock finally made his way to the ring brawling with Triple H back to the stage area (with Triple H continuing to beat on Angle despite being on a stretcher) before fighting back to the ring with Stephanie coming out (despite Triple H earlier telling her to stay backstage) only to accidentally hit her husband with the title belt.  Triple H resorted to using the sledgehammer to gain an advantage by working over the midsection of The Rock while Stephanie was able to drag Kurt Angle back down to ringside to help Triple H only for Angle to break up his pin & throw Triple H into the steps.  Angle went for revenge against Triple H by trying to use the sledgehammer himself but Stephanie stopped him only for Triple H to accidentally end up hitting Stephanie before Angle went ahead & used the hammer allowing Rock to take advantage of the entire situation.  Triple H has gone on record saying how this is the most unusual match he's ever been in & quite frankly, I can't disagree as it was in reality The Rock vs. Triple H featuring Kurt Angle but was definitely entertaining.
As a side note, the pedigree through the table on Kurt Angle was so impactful that WWE continued to show that clip for years during the commercials asking people to "Please Don't Try This At Home."
SummerSlam '00
[Triple H: That Damn Good; History Of The WWE Championship]

w/Undertaker vs. World Tag Team Champions Edge & Christian - A forgotten match here as this was mostly The Rock & Undertaker (in his "American Bad Ass" gimmick) doing completely dominate throughout the match causing Edge & Christian resorting to double teaming to try to get an advantage but this was pretty short & sweet but entertaining.
"RAW" Dec. '00

vs. Ric Flair - Another rare match here as Rock challenged Flair to this match in "Flair Country" with Rock having a more serious attitude than his usually does.  Both men tried to show each other up early & even traded shops in the corner.  At one point, they had a series where Flair was able to counter the People's Elbow into a figure four which was turned into a sharpshooter while the sharpshooter was turned into a figure four later in the match.  Flair gained confidence & even did Rock's own punches & spit combo but was too confident as Rock was able to get that opening to catch Flair off guard.  Good match for RAW with the special rare treat of seeing mutual respect shown after the match.
"RAW" July '02

WWE Undisputed Championship Match vs. Brock Lesnar - This was one of the most intense buildups to a match that WWE did around this time based off the video packages & idea that both men didn't touch leading up to this match.  Rock gave an idea of exactly where this match is going with Rock sprinting to the ring with Brock throwing across the ring with a belly to belly suplex.  Brock continued to show his superior strength by clothesling Rock over the barrier & pressing him above the barrier before dropping Rock on it ribs first before Brock completely focused on his ribs with shoulderblocks & waistlock bearhugs.  Rock had to resort to some dirty tactics & catching Brock off guard to get some offense in taking it to the outside & slingshotting Brock in the post before taking care of Paul Heyman.  With both men continuing to counter & kick out of each others signature holds, this match delivered on what it was setup to be...a highly intense match.
SummerSlam '02
[Brock Lesnar: Here Comes The Pain]

vs. Hulk Hogan - The Rock just recently returned to WWE but the crowd had completely turned on him for "selling out" leading to him being a heel.  Rock tried to avoid Hogan early to the point where Hogan went outside to get him before Rock caught Hogan coming into the ring with Hogan recovering & knocking Rock back out the ring.  Rock was able to get an advantage & started wearing Hogan's bandana & whipping Hogan with his own belt but he got too arrogant to the point where he was caught & given a taste of his own medicine.  Both men traded momentum including a chair getting involved before the lights were turned out & as Michael Cole said, "The Rock just shook hands with the devil."
No Way Out '03

(Blu-Ray) w/John Cena vs. The Miz & R-Truth - As eluded in the opening video package, The Rock makes his in-ring return to WWE for the first time since 2004 at WrestleMania XX at the same event he debuted 15 years earlier...with both occasions happening in the same building of Madison Square Garden. You clearly saw the tension between Cena & Rock as The Rock completely ignored Cena from the time he made his way to the ring to the start of the match & later distractions between the two cost them potential victory & allowed their opponents to get the advantage as Awesome Truth was able to "divide & conquer" keeping one opponent away from his partner however possible in a match that was a old school type of tag team match that was more based about the attraction of seeing The Rock's return to the ring & continued built towards the WrestleMania main event between Rock & Cena.
Survivor Series '11

I really enjoyed the documentary as it really highlighted The Rock's "journey" getting to the point where he is at now in his life.  Normally on these releases, I have issues with the match selection in terms of the DVD repeats however what I loved is that WWE didn't use any matches that were on Rock's previous anthology of matches (unlike Austin's last one) leaving room for some matches that have been unreleased until now like his debut & the infamous "I Quit" match with Mankind along with rare matches (I forgot all about the tag title match with Undertaker & his match against Ric Flair) while the repeats weren't on any projects in recent years.  In the end, this was the most pleased I've been with a superstar documentary in a long time from the documentary to the match selection so this is a project I would go out of my way to get...if you smell what I'm cookin'!

Wow, this 3 disk DVD is incredible.  Every single second is amazing, charting the life of in my opinion the greatest wrestller of all time alongside Stone Cold Steve Austin.  Easily the best WWE DVD i have ever purchased, you can tell the production values must have been enormous with the likes of chris jericho, triple h, vince and many many many more making an appearance.  I truly reccommend this DVD it is amazing and you won't be dissapointed.

some years ago i bought a 3 disc set of the rock but felt disappointed... and then i saw this one expecting the exact same thing. but its not. the first disc has a documentary about the rock from when he was young to wrestle mania and a preview to john cena vs the rock.

the 2nd disc had his debut at survivor series. a raw match vs triple h, ladder match vs triple h, thriple threat match vs mankkind and ken shamrock. the infamous i quit match vs mankind and he no hold barred match at backlash in 99 when shane mcmahan was ref.

disc 3
vs triple h vs kurt angle where angle actually had a concusion during the begging of the match and still finished it. tag team with undertaker vs edge and christian,  vs ric flair, vs brock lesnar , vs hulk hogan the rock returns to raw, the rock concert 2, and wrestlemania 2011
Simply he is the best wrestler of all the time + a great actor. Highly recommended to watch . Thanks to WWE for making this movie.

Love this collection of the great one. The biography is awesome loaded with interviews with a lot of the guys who rivaled the rock (even punk and cena) The match selection is cool too because most of the matches aren't available on dvd so I like that they did that. Especially the i quit match and no holds barred against Austin. The Rock returns to raw promo which is one of his best is absolutely hilarious. The Rock as a heel in some ways is better because he was such a jerk that you couldn't help but laugh, just like Triple H says in the biography. If you like or love the Rock, then get this. It will be enjoyed for sure.

I really enjoyed the documentary on the Rock's life and career. The WWE did a really good job setting up the documentary by going into details. Watching old footages with the Rock in the Attitude Era brought back great memories of when I was a kid. The Rock is probably the only wrestler I know to be loved by fans as a Heel or a Face. Overall, I gave the first disc 5 out 5. However, I was a little disappointed with the selections of matches by WWE. Rock had other great matches that should've been added to this collection, such as Judgment day 2000 where the Rock fought Triple H in an Ironman Match for the WWF/E Championship, Wrestlemania 2000 Fatal Four way match for the WWF/E championship and many others. Lucky I have Rock's previous DVD "The Most Electrifying man in Sports entertainment", which has way more matches, so if I ever want to see his other matches I'll put this one on. Otherwise, pretty good DVD for younger fans who weren't around to see The Rock perform in the ring.

you get plenty of matches in this dvd you also get a documentary in this one about the rocks career with commentary from y2j,mick foley,stone cold,hhh and a few other so that makes it worth it on it self but it really good dvd its a must have and the rock also gives his reason why he left for 7 years from the wwe so go pick it up its worth it
my kids loved it
